abstract: Federal investigators have organized a task force to examine any wrongdoing at Washington Mutual, the troubled savings bank that regulators seized and sold to JPMorgan Chase late last month, The New York Times’s Eric Dash reported.
lead_paragraph: Federal investigators have organized a task force to examine any wrongdoing at Washington Mutual, the troubled savings bank that regulators seized and sold to JPMorgan Chase late last month, The New York Times’s Eric Dash reported.

headline.main: Federal Investigators to Examine Washington Mutual

abstract: JPMorgan Chase agreed to allow bankrupt savings and loan Washington Mutual Inc.‘s parent company to access $4.4 billion of its funds that may be used to help pay creditors.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase agreed to allow bankrupt savings and loan Washington Mutual Inc.‘s parent company to access $4.4 billion of its funds that may be used to help pay creditors.

headline.main: JPMorgan Grants WaMu Parent Acess to $4.4 Billion

abstract: JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and State Street have weathered these bad times better than most banks. But things are about to get worse, The New York Times’s Eric Dash writes.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and State Street have weathered these bad times better than most banks. But things are about to get worse, The New York Times’s Eric Dash writes.

headline.main: Banks Brace for Slump as Economy Weakens
